acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 96-hour LC50=162mg/L of fishes (Fathead minnows) (ECETOC TR91, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on guinea pig LD50 >20600mg/kg (PATTY (5th, 2001)), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: The saturated vapor pressures concentrations pressure of acetophenones is 523.7ppm (25degC), it is presumed that the inhalation study was done in the state of steam. There is no data about mists.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: The saturated vapor pressure concentration of acetophenones is 523.7ppm (25degC). And it was presumed that the inhalation test was done in the state of steam. But LC50 value was unknown (PATTY (5th, 2001)), it was presupposed that it cannot be classified due to data insufficiency.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was set as Category 4 based on rat LD50=956.3 mg/kg calculated from four test results (900, 900, 3000, and 3200 mg/kg) (PATTY (5th, 2001)) of rat LD50.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the technical guide, it considered as the outside of Category from the segment D of EPA (IRIS (2004)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (aqueous solubility = 6130 mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Although flash point data varies from 82 - 105 degC, it was classified as Category 4 (GHS standards: flash point being more than 60 degC but 93 degC or less) as the lowest flash point being 82 degC (Open Cup).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since we only found the data of the in vitro mutagenicity test and found no strong positive findings, we presupposed that we could not categorze it by the technical guideline.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon (but not to other elements).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: The ignition points is 570 - 571 degC (Chapman (1982-200), an organic compounds dictionary (1985), ICSC (J), (1994))

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the statement of severe irritation (PATTY (5th, 2001)) and moderate irritation, and transient cornea damage (IUCLID (2000)) by the test using a rabbit, it was set as Category 2A. In addition, there is the preexisting classification of EU-Annex 1: Xi; R36.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the descriptions of slight edema (IUCLID (2000)) and mild skin reaction (RTECS (2005)) in rabbit tests, it was classified as Category 3.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the negative statement of the test cases in humans and guinea pigs(PATTY (5th, 2001)) , it was put outside of the Category.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It is indicated that harmful effects were not seen in the 10000 ppm feeding administration test for 17 weeks using a rat (equivalent to about 500 mg/kg/day by a technical guide) (PATTY (5th, 2001) and ACGIH (2001)) and this dose exceeds the upper limit of the Category 2 guidance value range. Moreover, also in occupational exposure in humans, there is the statement that harmful effect is not reported (ACGIH (2001)). It was classified to outside of Category according to these things.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the descriptions that there are cases that it was used as an anesthetics by humans (ACGIH (2001)), and that anesthetic actions were observed by medication to rats (PATTY (5th, 2001)), it was set as Category 3 (anesthetic actions).
